message.content:
Search the splice-cep directory for any hardcoded paths that would break on different Mac configurations.

Look for:
1. Hardcoded user paths like /Users/developer/ or /Users/imorgado/
2. Non-platform-agnostic path construction (not using path.join)
3. Hardcoded Adobe installation paths
4. Any file path strings that don't use proper path resolution

Fix all issues found by using path.join() and proper environment variables or config paths.

content.text: I'll search the splice-cep directory for hardcoded paths that could break on different Mac configurations.
The splice-cep directory is not in splice-website. Let me find where it actually is.
Found it at `/Users/imorgado/SPLICE/splice-cep`. Now let me search for hardcoded paths.

content.text: The matches in markdown files are documentation, not code. Let me search specifically in the JavaScript and JSX source files for hardcoded paths.
Good, no hardcoded user paths in JS/JSX files. Now let me check for other path-related issues like string concatenation for paths instead of proper path handling.
Let me read the hostScript.jsx file to check for path construction patterns and any hardcoded paths.
I found potential issues in the hostScript.jsx file. Let me also check the JavaScript files in the panel directory and look for more path-related issues.
Now let me check the other JavaScript files for path-related issues and also look for string concatenation in path construction.

I found the issues in hostScript.jsx. There are hardcoded path separators (`/`) and path concatenation using `+` instead of proper path joining. In ExtendScript (JSX), the recommended approach is to use the `File` and `Folder` objects with proper path resolution.

Let me check the specific context of these path issues.

Now I can see the issues clearly. In ExtendScript (JSX for Adobe apps), paths should be constructed using `Folder` and `File` objects properly. The issue is that the code uses string concatenation with `/` which will break on Windows since Windows uses `\`.

Let me fix the hostScript.jsx file to use proper cross-platform path construction.

lines: if (!seq) return JSON.stringify({ error: "No active sequence" });
+        // Generate temp file path using proper cross-platform path construction
// Check if we have audio tracks with content
// Find audio-only preset or use default
-                // Try to find WAV preset in common locations
+                // Try to find WAV preset in common locations using cross-platform path construction

content.text: Now let me also check for any other JavaScript files that might have path issues and also verify there are no other hardcoded paths in shell scripts or configuration files.
The test files are using `path.join()` correctly with `__dirname`, which is good. Let me also check the CSInterface.js file for any path-related issues.

The CSInterface.js is fine - it delegates path handling to the Adobe CEP runtime which handles cross-platform paths correctly.

Let me also check the CSXS manifest and any configuration files for hardcoded paths.

file.content:
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>
<ExtensionManifest xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance"
                   ExtensionBundleId="com.splice.panel"
                   ExtensionBundleVersion="6.0.8"
                   Version="11.0">

    <ExtensionList>
        <Extension Id="com.splice.panel.main" Version="6.0.8"/>
    </ExtensionList>

    <ExecutionEnvironment>
        <HostList>
            <!-- PP 2022 (v22.x), PP 2023 (v23.x), PP 2024 (v24.x), PP 2025 (v25.x) -->
            <Host Name="PPRO" Version="[22.0,99.9]"/>
        </HostList>
        <LocaleList>
            <Locale Code="All"/>
        </LocaleList>
        <RequiredRuntimeList>
            <!-- CEP 11 supports PP 2022-2025 -->
            <RequiredRuntime Name="CSXS" Version="11.0"/>
        </RequiredRuntimeList>
    </ExecutionEnvironment>

    <DispatchInfoList>
        <Extension Id="com.splice.panel.main">
            <DispatchInfo>
                <Resources>
                    <MainPath>./panel/index.html</MainPath>
                    <ScriptPath>./jsx/hostScript.jsx</ScriptPath>
                    <CEFCommandLine>
                        <Parameter>--allow-file-access</Parameter>
                        <Parameter>--allow-file-access-from-files</Parameter>
                        <Parameter>--enable-nodejs</Parameter>
                        <Parameter>--mixed-context</Parameter>
                    </CEFCommandLine>
                </Resources>
                <AccessList>
                    <URLAccess>
                        <URL>https://splice-api-production.up.railway.app</URL>
                        <URL>https://spliceclips.com</URL>
                        <URL>https://splice.video</URL>
                    </URLAccess>
                </AccessList>
                <Lifecycle>
                    <AutoVisible>true</AutoVisible>
                </Lifecycle>
                <UI>
                    <Type>Panel</Type>
                    <Menu>SPLICE - AI Video Editor</Menu>
                    <Geometry>
                        <Size>
                            <Height>800</Height>
                            <Width>400</Width>
                        </Size>
                        <MinSize>
                            <Height>400</Height>
                            <Width>300</Width>
                        </MinSize>
                        <MaxSize>
                            <Height>2000</Height>
                            <Width>800</Width>
                        </MaxSize>
                    </Geometry>
                    <Icons>
                        <Icon Type="Normal">./panel/icons/icon-light.png</Icon>
                        <Icon Type="DarkNormal">./panel/icons/icon-dark.png</Icon>
                    </Icons>
                </UI>
            </DispatchInfo>
        </Extension>
    </DispatchInfoList>
</ExtensionManifest>

content.text:
Both configuration files look good. The manifest.xml uses relative paths (`./panel/`, `./jsx/`) which is correct for CEP extensions, and the `.debug` file has no hardcoded paths.

Let me also scan for any remaining path-related issues in the broader codebase.

The matches are in `.claude/file-changes.json` which is a local development artifact and not part of the deployed code. These can be ignored.

Now let me verify the fix I made and provide a summary.
